data.title: Alcohol Concentration
data.statement:
You have some alcohol solution, but you don't know its concentration.

To find out, you take out some of the solution and measure its mass and volume. Write a program to find the volume concentration with these two measurements.

Constants:
Density of water = 1 g/ml
Density of alcohol = 0.79 g/ml

In this problem, assume that volumes are additive. I.e., mixing two solutions of volumes [[v₁]] and [[v₂]] respectively gives a solution of volume [[v₁]] + [[v₂]]. Note that it may not hold in real life.
data.constraints:
[[m]], [[v]] > 0
All measurements are free of errors. I.e., 0.79 × [[v]] ≤ [[m]] ≤ 1 × [[v]].
data.stubGenerator:
read m:float
read v:float
write volume concentration
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A floating-point number [[m]] for the mass of the solution in grams.
<<Line 2:>> A floating-point number [[v]] for the volume of the solution in millilitres.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The volume concentration of alcohol in percent, rounded to the nearest integer, with the percent sign.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have some alcohol solution, but you don't know its concentration.

To find out, you take out some of the solution and measure its mass and volume. Write a program to find the volume concentration with these two measurements.

Constants:
Density of water = 1 g/ml
Density of alcohol = 0.79 g/ml

In this problem, assume that volumes are additive. I.e., mixing two solutions of volumes v₁ and v₂ respectively gives a solution of volume v₁ + v₂. Note that it may not hold in real life.
Input
Line 1: A floating-point number m for the mass of the solution in grams.
Line 2: A floating-point number v for the volume of the solution in millilitres.
Output
Line 1: The volume concentration of alcohol in percent, rounded to the nearest integer, with the percent sign.
Constraints
m, v > 0
All measurements are free of errors. I.e., 0.79 × v ≤ m ≤ 1 × v.
Example
Input
505.5
600
Output
75%
